intro: Nemophila nevadensis, commonly known as the Sierra violet, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows in moist, shady areas such as forest floors and meadows. It has hairy, ovate leaves and produces capsules as its fruit. Nemophila nevadensis is often found in mountainous regions and is adapted to cool, temperate climates.
